definitions.definition: A combination or interweaving of letters, as the initials of a name; a device; a monogram.
definitions.example: a painter's cipher, an engraver's cipher, etc.

definitions.definition: A method of transforming a text in order to conceal its meaning.
definitions.example: The message was written in a simple cipher. Anyone could figure it out.

definitions.definition: A cryptographic system using an algorithm that converts letters or sequences of bits into ciphertext.
Ciphertext; a message concealed via a cipher.
definitions.example: The message is clearly a cipher, but I can't figure it out.

definitions.definition: A grouping of three digits in a number, especially when delimited by commas or periods:
definitions.example: The probability is 1 in 1,000,000,000,000,000 — a number having five ciphers of zeros.

definitions.definition: A fault in an organ valve which causes a pipe to sound continuously without the key having been pressed.
The path (usually circular) shared cannabis takes through a group, an occasion of cannabis smoking.
Someone or something of no importance.

definitions.example: I never learned much more than how to read and cipher.

definitions.definition: To write in code or cipher.
Of an organ pipe: to sound independent of the organ.
